00031 
00032 // Interface to the Grid ctor class. Grids contain a single array (the `main'
00033 // array) of dimension N and N single dimension arrays (map arrays). For any
00034 // dimension n of the main array, the size of the nth map array must match
00035 // the size of the main array's nth dimension. Grids are used to map
00036 // non-integer scales to multidimensional point data.
00037 //
00038 // jhrg 9/15/94
00039 
00040 #ifndef _grid_h
00041 #define _grid_h 1
00042 
00043 #ifdef _GNUG_
00044 #pragma interface
00045 #endif
00046 
00047 #include <vector>
00048 
00049 #include "Pix.h"
00050 
00051 #ifndef _basetype_h
00052 #include "BaseType.h"
00053 #endif
00054 
00055 #ifndef _constructor_h
00056 #include "Constructor.h"
00057 #endif
00058 
00059 #if defined(TRACE_NEW) && !defined(_trace_new_h)
00060 #include "trace_new.h"
00061 #endif
00062 
00112 class Grid: public Constructor {
00113 private:
00114     BaseType *_array_var;
00115     std::vector<BaseType *> _map_vars;
00116     
00117     void _duplicate(const Grid &s);
00118 
00119 public:
00120 
00121     Grid(const string &n = "");
00122     Grid(const Grid &rhs);
00123     virtual ~Grid();
00124 
00125     typedef std::vector<BaseType *>::const_iterator Map_citer ;
00126     typedef std::vector<BaseType *>::iterator Map_iter ;
00127 
00128     
00129     Grid &operator=(const Grid &rhs);
00130     virtual BaseType *ptr_duplicate();
00131 
00132     virtual int element_count(bool leaves = false);
00133 
00134     virtual void set_send_p(bool state);
00135     virtual void set_read_p(bool state);
00136     virtual void set_in_selection(bool state);
00137 
00138     virtual BaseType *var(const string &n, bool exact = true,
00139               btp_stack *s = 0);
00140 
00141     virtual BaseType *var(const string &n, btp_stack &s);
00142 
00143     virtual void add_var(BaseType *bt, Part part);
00144 
00145     BaseType *array_var();
00146 
00147     Pix first_map_var();
00148     void next_map_var(Pix p);
00149     BaseType *map_var(Pix p);
00150 
00151     virtual unsigned int width();
00152 
00153     virtual int components(bool constrained = false);
00154 
00155     virtual bool projection_yields_grid();
00156 
00157     virtual bool serialize(const string &dataset, DDS &dds, XDR *sink,
00158                bool ce_eval = true);
00159     virtual bool deserialize(XDR *source, DDS *dds, bool reuse = false);
00160 
00161 #if 0
00162     virtual bool read(const string &dataset);
00163 #endif
00164 
00165     virtual unsigned int val2buf(void *buf, bool reuse = false);
00166 
00167     virtual unsigned int buf2val(void **val);
00168 
00169     virtual void print_decl(ostream &os, string space = "    ",
00170                 bool print_semi = true,
00171                 bool constraint_info = false,
00172                 bool constrained = false);
00173 
00174     virtual void print_decl(FILE *out, string space = "    ",
00175                 bool print_semi = true,
00176                 bool constraint_info = false,
00177                 bool constrained = false);
00178 
00179     virtual void print_val(ostream &os, string space = "",
00180                bool print_decl_p = true);
00181 
00182      virtual void print_val(FILE *out, string space = "",
00183                bool print_decl_p = true);
00184 
00185    virtual bool check_semantics(string &msg, bool all = false);
00187     Map_iter map_begin() ;
00188 
00191     Map_iter map_end() ;
00192 
00193     Map_iter get_map_iter(int i);
00194 };

00273  * been updated so that leaf variables which contain dots in their names
00274  * will be found. Note that constructor variables with dots in their names
00275  * will break the lookup routines unless the ctor is the last field in the
00276  * constraint expression. These changes were made to fix bug 330.

00281  * Revision 1.38.4.1  2001/06/05 06:49:19  jimg
00282  * Added the Constructor class which is to Structures, Sequences and Grids
00283  * what Vector is to Arrays and Lists. This should be used in future
00284  * refactorings (I thought it was going to be used for the back pointers).
00285  * Introduced back pointers so children can refer to their parents in
00286  * hierarchies of variables.
00287  * Added to Sequence methods to tell if a child sequence is done
00288  * deserializing its data.
00289  * Fixed the operator=() and copy ctors; removed redundency from
00290  * _duplicate().
00291  * Changed the way serialize and deserialize work for sequences. Now SOI and
00292  * EOS markers are written for every `level' of a nested Sequence. This
00293  * should fixed nested Sequences. There is still considerable work to do
00294  * for these to work in all cases.

00299  * wrapped headers included in other headers in those guard symbols (to cut
00300  * down on extraneous file processing - See Lakos).
00301  *
00302  * Revision 1.37  2000/09/21 16:22:08  jimg
00303  * Merged changes from Jose Garcia that add exceptions to the software.
00304  * Many methods that returned error codes now throw exectptions. There are
00305  * two classes which are thrown by the software, Error and InternalErr.
00306  * InternalErr is used to report errors within the library or errors using
00307  * the library. Error is used to reprot all other errors. Since InternalErr
00308  * is a subclass of Error, programs need only to catch Error.

00380  * Multiple connections are now possible. It is now possible to open several

00383  * deserialize mfuncs. Connect was also modified so that it manages the data
00384  * source `object' (which is just an XDR pointer).

00425  * config header should follow the convention config_<name>.h.
00426  *
00427  * Revision 1.10  1995/03/04  14:35:01  jimg
00428  * Major modifications to the transmission and representation of values:
00429  * Added card() virtual function which is true for classes that
00430  * contain cardinal types (byte, int float, string).
00431  * Changed the representation of Str from the C rep to a C++
00432  * class represenation.
00433  * Chnaged read_val and store_val so that they take and return
00434  * types that are stored by the object (e.g., inthe case of Str
00435  * an URL, read_val returns a C++ String object).
00436  * Modified Array representations so that arrays of card()
00437  * objects are just that - no more storing strings, ... as
00438  * C would store them.
00439  * Arrays of non cardinal types are arrays of the DODS objects (e.g.,
00440  * an array of a structure is represented as an array of Structure
00441  * objects).
00442  *
00443  * Revision 1.9  1995/02/10  02:23:06  jimg
00444  * Added DBMALLOC includes and switch to code which uses malloc/free.
00445  * Private and protected symbols now start with `_'.
00446  * Added new accessors for name and type fields of BaseType; the old ones
00447  * will be removed in a future release.
00448  * Added the store_val() mfunc. It stores the given value in the object's
00449  * internal buffer.
00450  * Made both List and Str handle their values via pointers to memory.
00451  * Fixed read_val().
00452  * Made serialize/deserialize handle all malloc/free calls (even in those
00453  * cases where xdr initiates the allocation).
00454  * Fixed print_val().
00455  *

00458  * implementations.
00459  * Changed the declaration of readVal in BaseType so that it names the
00460  * mfunc read_val (to be consistant with the other mfunc names).
00461  * Removed the unnecessary duplicate declaration of the abstract virtual
00462  * mfuncs read and (now) read_val from the classes Byte, ... Grid. The
00463  * declaration in BaseType is sufficient along with the decl and definition
00464  * in the *.cc,h files which contain the subclasses for Byte, ..., Grid.
